Content:
Gary Ledbetter, was born in Arkansas but grew up in Summerville, S.C. After his high school graduation he attended Clemson University and received a degree in Civil Engineering in 1973. he received Christ as his Savior while a student in college. After graduation from college he worked as an engineer for the SCDOT in Orangeburg and St. Mathews, S.C. In 1978 Gary entered seminary in Greenville, S.C. and received his Master of Divinity degree in 1982.

He then moved to Houston, Texas where he started a church and pastored for nearly eight years. He and his family moved to Cheraw, S.C. in 1990 where he planted a church and pastored for eleven years. Gary completed his Doctor of Ministry degree in 1992. In 2001 he was called to pastor a church in Irmo, S.C. near Columbia. In 2010 his wife died from cancer and he later moved to Rock Hill, S.C. to start his ministry with hospice. 

He met Linda in 2012 when she attended the church where he was a member. She had recently moved to Rock Hill from Sweetwater, TN. after her husband died with cancer. Gary and Linda were married in August of 2013 and were called to minister at Victory in December of that year. They have seven children and fifteen grandchildren.

Gary and Linda have a genuine love for the Lord and for people. Gary has a passion for studying and preaching the Word of God, and telling others about Jesus. He and Linda are sincerely concerned for you and your family.
